sentence.Network_en: Be careful not to capsize the boat.
The boat will capsize if you don't sit down.
sentence.Network_cn: 你要是不坐下,船就要翻了.

sentence.Network_en: Philippine toll of 155 could rise sharply after ferry capsize.
sentence.Network_cn: 菲律宾统计死亡人数为155人,但估计这个数字之后将迅速升高.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 18th cent.: perhaps based on Spanish capuzar 'sink (a ship) by the head', from cabo 'head' + chapuzar 'to dive or duck'

entry.def: If you capsize a boat or if it capsizes, it turns upside down in the water.

example.ex: The sea got very rough and the boat capsized...
example.tran: 海上波涛汹涌,小船翻了。

example.ex: I didn't count on his capsizing the raft.
example.tran: 我没有想到他会把筏子弄翻。

sentences.sentence: "Don't rock the boat or it will capsize!"

sentences.en: A family’s outing ended in tragedy when their boat capsized.
sentences.cn: 一家人出游，结果船翻了，造成悲剧。

sentences.en: Her own boat capsized after she attempted a rescue.
sentences.cn: 她在设法营救别人时自己的船也翻了。

sentences.en: The crew seemed unable to right the capsized yacht.
sentences.cn: 水手们好像无法使倾覆的游艇翻过来。
